snippet: Invoking his right to privacy, President François Hollande said at a news conference that everyone suffers “difficult moments.”
abstract: French Pres Francois Hollande deflects questions about his affair with actress during speech to address France's economic challenges, insisting on privacy in personal matters; role of Hollande's official consort Valerie Trierweiler in public affairs has been thrown into question after revelation of affair.

byline.contributor: Maïa de la Baume and Scott Sayare contributed reporting from Paris, and Alan Cowell from London.

lead_paragraph: Invoking his right to privacy, President François Hollande said at a news conference that everyone suffers “difficult moments.”

headline.main: French Leader Brushes Aside Questions Over Affair
headline.print_headline: French Leader Brushes Aside Questions Over Affair
